cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to enter the central Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the Louisiana-Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwest Louisiana coast (near the Cameron–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time – watches confined to Caribbean islands and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time – warnings confined to Hispaniola, eastern Cuba and nearby islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline and upper Texas coast expected to be impacted as the storm approaches mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at the port with a cumulative 34-kt probability of 51% and up to a 23% chance of 50-kt winds by mid-week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast guidance suggests 3–6 ft or higher storm surge possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent bays, which would inundate low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, raising the risk of flash flooding and river rises along the Mississippi.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas in the lower river approaches and the Gulf entrance channel; potential temporary closure of navigation channels; possible power outages and debris impacting port operations.
